org.safs

Class DatabaseUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.DatabaseUtils

  • public class DatabaseUtils
extends java.lang.Object

    Purpose: Utilities to find a database connection using java.sql.DriverManager; can also getValues.

    Since:
    Oct 23, 2003
    Oct 23, 2003 (DBauman) Original Release
    Author:
    Doug Bauman

      • loadDriver

                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        load the driver, if 'driver' is null then uses DEFAULT_DRIVER
        Parameters:
        driver, - String
        Returns:
        Class, the class loaded with Class.forName
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getConnection

        public static java.sql.Connection getConnection(java.lang.String jdbcUrl,
                                                java.lang.String username,
                                                java.lang.String password)
                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Opens a connection to the JDBC database indicated by the 'dbName' parameter.
        Parameters:
        jdbcUrl - The database url
        username - String, if null then uses the 1-parameter version of DriverManager.getConnection
        password - String
        Returns:
        The connection.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the connection fails.

      • setupSelect

        protected static java.lang.String setupSelect(java.lang.StringBuffer buf,
                                              java.lang.String table,
                                              java.lang.String field,
                                              java.lang.String attr,
                                              java.lang.Object value)

        Purpose: setup select statement
        Parameters:
        buf, - StringBuffer
        table, - String name of the table
        field, - String the select field name
        attr, - String the attr part for the where, if null then no where
        value, - if attr!=null, then the value part of where, if null, then the where part will be "attr NOT NULL"
        Returns:
        String, the statement

      • getResultSet

        public static java.sql.ResultSet getResultSet(java.sql.Connection con,
                                              java.lang.String strStatement,
                                              java.lang.String table,
                                              java.lang.String field,
                                              java.lang.String attr,
                                              java.lang.Object value,
                                              java.sql.Statement[] st)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException

        Purpose: simple query, as in: "SELECT field FROM table WHERE attr = 'value'" or if attr is null then simply "SELECT field FROM table"
        Assumptions: Note: this version does not take into account special characters. You need a more sophisticated mechanism to take those into account.
        Parameters:
        con, - Connection
        strStatement, - String the statement, if null, then construct from the other parameters
        table, - String name of the table
        field, - String the select field name
        attr, - String the attr part for the where, if null then no where
        value, - if attr!=null, then the value part of where, if null, then the where part will be "attr NOT NULL"
        st, - Statement[], pointer to a return'ed Statement
        Returns:
        ResultSet from the executeQuery on the statment
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • execStatement

        public static int execStatement(java.sql.Connection con,
                                java.lang.String strStatement)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException

        Purpose: execute statement, can be used to do update or insert
        Assumptions: Note: this version does not take into account special characters. You need a more sophisticated mechanism to take those into account.
        Parameters:
        con - Connection
        strStatement - String the statement
        Returns:
        either the row count for INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE statements; or 0 for SQL statements that return nothing
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

                               throws java.sql.SQLException

        Assumptions: Note: this version does not take into account special characters. You need a more sophisticated mechanism to take those into account.
        Parameters:
        con, - Connection
        table, - String the table name
        whereCl, - String the where clause
        Returns:
        either the row count for INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE statements; or 0 for SQL statements that return nothing

      • getValue

        public static java.util.List getValue(java.sql.Connection con,
                                      java.lang.String strStatement,
                                      java.lang.String table,
                                      java.lang.String field,
                                      java.lang.String attr,
                                      java.lang.Object value,
                                      java.util.ArrayList columns)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException

        Purpose: simple get, as in: "SELECT field FROM table WHERE attr = 'value'" or if attr is null then simply "SELECT field FROM table"
        Assumptions: Note: this version does not take into account special characters. You need a more sophisticated mechanism to take those into account.
        Parameters:
        con, - Connection
        strStatement, - String the statement, if null, then construct from the other parameters
        table, - String name of the table
        field, - String the select field name
        attr, - String the attr part for the where, if null then no where
        value, - if attr!=null, then the value part of where, if null, then the where part will be "attr NOT NULL"
        columns, - if not null, then we add the columns to this list
        Returns:
        a 'List' which is represents the first row; if no rows, then null
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getValues

        public static java.util.List getValues(java.sql.Connection con,
                                       java.lang.String strStatement,
                                       java.lang.String table,
                                       java.lang.String field,
                                       java.lang.String attr,
                                       java.lang.Object value,
                                       java.util.ArrayList columns,
                                       java.lang.Integer maxRowCount,
                                       java.lang.Integer maxColCount)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException

        Purpose: simple get(all), as in: "SELECT field FROM table WHERE attr = 'value'" or if attr is null then simply "SELECT field FROM table"
        Assumptions: Note: this version does not take into account special characters. You need a more sophisticated mechanism to take those into account.
        Parameters:
        con, - Connection
        strStatement, - String the statement, if null, then construct from the other parameters
        table, - String name of the table
        field, - String the select field name
        attr, - String the attr part for the where, if null then no where
        value, - if attr!=null, then the value part of where, if null, then the where part will be "attr NOT NULL"
        columns, - if not null, then we add the columns to this list
        maxRowCount, - if not null, then don't return more rows then specified
        maxColCount, - if not null, then don't return more cols then specified
        Returns:
        List of 'List' which is a list of rows in the database, the rows are items for each column, as they are encountered
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getNumColumns

        public static int getNumColumns(java.sql.Connection con,
                                java.lang.String strStatement,
                                java.lang.String table,
                                java.lang.String field,
                                java.lang.String attr,
                                java.lang.Object value,
                                java.util.ArrayList columns)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException

        Purpose: simple get(all), as in: "SELECT field FROM table WHERE attr = 'value'" or if attr is null then simply "SELECT field FROM table"; in order to get number of columns, and/or to get the names of the columns in parameter 'columns'
        Assumptions: Note: this version does not take into account special characters. You need a more sophisticated mechanism to take those into account.
        Parameters:
        con, - Connection
        strStatement, - String the statement, if null, then construct from the other parameters
        table, - String name of the table
        field, - String the select field name
        attr, - String the attr part for the where, if null then no where
        value, - if attr!=null, then the value part of where, if null, then the where part will be "attr NOT NULL"
        columns, - if not null, then we add the columns to this list
        Returns:
        int, number of columns
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getRow

        public static java.util.List getRow(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException

        Purpose: get the next row from the ResultSet as a Collection
        Assumptions: that rs.next() was already called and is true. This version calls the getRow with the metadata and the column count
        Parameters:
        rs, - ResultSet
        Returns:
        List of items in the row, if rs.next() is null, then null
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getRow

        public static java.util.List getRow(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                    java.sql.ResultSetMetaData meta,
                                    int numberOfColumns,
                                    java.lang.Integer maxColCount)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException

        Purpose: get the next row from the ResultSet as a Collection
        Assumptions: that rs.next() was already called and is true
        Parameters:
        rs, - ResultSet
        meta, - ResultSetMetaData (obtained externally via rs.getMetaData())
        numberOfColumns, - int (obtained externally via meta.getColumnCount())
        maxColCount, - Integer
        Returns:
        List of items in the row, as they are encountered
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • closeAll

        public static void closeAll(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                            java.sql.Statement st,
                            java.sql.Connection conn)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Convenience method for closing sql objects. Closing is tried on all objects, independent of errors/exceptions in previous closes.
        Parameters:
        rs - ResultSet to be closed
        st - Statement (or subclass) to be closed
        conn - Connection to be closed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when any problem occurs while closing objects

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] arg)
        test main method. reads username and password as first two lines in c:\test.dat the remaining lines in the file are optional and include:
        jdbcUrl,
        tableName (default is
        col (the select column, default is *)
        dbName

      • writefile

        public static void writefile(java.lang.String filename,
                             java.util.Collection list,
                             java.lang.String delim)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        write to file 'filename' the toString() values contained in list. Each item is written as a separate line using '\n' as the line separator regardless of operating system. Values are written in the system default character encoding.

        If an item in the list is another Collection, then special handling is performed via the getDBVal function to potentially filter the value to be written. The items in this secondary Collection are treated as delimited fields and will be separated in the output by the field delimiter provided.

        Parameters:
        filename - String full absolute path filename of file to write.
        list - Collection of lines to write.
        delim - String field separator to use on values stored in Collections in the list.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file cannot be created for any reason.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during write operations.
        See Also:
        FileUtilities.getSystemBufferedFileWriter(String), getDBVal(Object)

      • getDBVal

        public static java.lang.String getDBVal(java.lang.Object m)

        Purpose: getDBVal as a string if the type is "java.lang.Double", "java.sql.Timestamp" or "java.sql.Date" the we remove trailing .0 if exists.
        Parameters:
        m, - Object
        Returns:
        String, if m was null then ""
